thread.title: Kasper Schmeichel pays tribute to sacked Leicester boss Claudio Ranieri - "he deserves massive respect"
thread.title_full: Kasper Schmeichel pays tribute to sacked Leicester boss Claudio Ranieri - "he deserves massive respect"

author: Jacob Murtagh
title: Kasper Schmeichel pays tribute to sacked Leicester boss Claudio Ranieri - "he deserves massive respect"
text:
Get football   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Kasper Schmeichel has paid tribute to Claudio Ranieri after he was axed by Leicester on Thursday. 
The Italian led the Foxes to the title but was given the boot nine months later after a disastrous run of form that leaves them hovering above the Premier League drop zone. 
However, keeper Schmeichel has taken to social media to thank Ranieri for his efforts at the King Power Stadium. 
He posted a picture of the pair on Instagram, along with the caption: "I would like to thank Claudio for everything he's done for Leicester City Football Club, and for me personally. 
"He deserves massive respect and huge credit for what he achieved here with us." 
MirrorSport understands senior Leicester players recently complained about to the club owner Vichai Srivaddhanaprabha. 
After winning the title with a settled side and formation, Ranieri's 'tinkering' this season drove his title winners mad and they feared he was taking them down. Read More
